body_html:
thanks @lukaszkaiser -- I have been using the one in seq2seq since its release. The biggest problem though is that you are forced to used a cpu for the softmax, meaning you can't take advantage of using another gpu to do the softmax. As a result, it does lead to longer training times.

I'll close this issue. But I wouldn't mind trying to help out to get this done on the gpu! Thanks!

body:
thanks @lukaszkaiser -- I have been using the one in seq2seq since its release. The biggest problem though is that you are forced to used a cpu for the softmax, meaning you can't take advantage of using another gpu to do the softmax. As a result, it does lead to longer training times. 

I'll close this issue. But I wouldn't mind trying to help out to get this done on the gpu! Thanks!
